avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has widely settled and thawed in warm conditions and therefore stabilized. Risk of slip and slide in icy conditions high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted considerably in last weeks warming. Temperature fluctuations are expected for this week in strong E winds and minor snowfall could fall on Wedensday. The snowpack is widely isothermal and homogenous but slippery conditions could be dangerous as the snow is mostly frozen in the mountains.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have therefore likely have grown in W-S facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have widely formed in W-S facing aspect both in the east and the north of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar snjókoma snemma á þriðjudag í austlægum áttum. Annars stillt og hiti víða við frostmark í byrjun vikunnar.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches last seven days.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted in the recent warm weather, and measurements indicate that the snowpack has become isothermal in many mountainous areas. It can be expected to further strengthen with overnight frost in the coming days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during last week"s warm weather. Snow stakes indicate that the snowpack has generally reached isothermal conditions after the warmth. It can be expected that it has further consolidated in the cold weather and overnight frost this week.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have therefore likely have grown in W-S facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have widely formed in W-S facing aspect both in the east and the north of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA- og A-átt. Lítilsháttar snjókoma af og til, rigning eða slydda á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a wet loose avalanche in Hrafnaskál last week during a warming episode. Few slabs also fell in Siglufjörður and more loose avalanches in Ólafsfjörður early last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: E- to NE snowfall is expected for Tuesday and Wednesday and snow could drift and form wind slabs in SW facing hills. Older snowpack is considered homogenous and stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened during warming in all elevations since last week and overnight freezing after the weekend. Hardpack snow is widespread and the older snowpack is considered homogenous and stable. Diurnal temperature fluctuations affect surface snow on S-aspects where solar effect is greatest. Snowfall in E-winds is expected for Tuesday and Wednesday and snow could drift into southwestern facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have therefore likely have grown in W-S facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have widely formed in W-S facing aspect both in the east and the north of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma er væntanleg í austlægum áttum til fjalla aðfaranótt þriðjudags. Hvessir síðar í NA áttum með miðvikudeginum og meiri snjókoma. Hiti við frostmark á láglendi en frystir til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Rather small slab avalanches released 6th March due to solar radiation in highest mountains in Fjarðarheiði and around Seyðisfjörður. When temperature rose on Monday several avalanches released in the forecasting area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lot of new snow expected on Tuesday and Wednesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. In the lower parts of the mountains the snow should generally be stable. Lot of new snow expected on Tuesday and Wednesday.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have therefore likely have grown in W-S facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in easterly winds and that will continue in N winds tomorrow. Wind slabs have widely formed in W-S facing aspect both in the east and the north of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt og mikil snjókoma á þriðjudag en rigning á láglendi. Snýst í N-átt með áframhaldandi snjókomu á miðvikudag. Úrkomulítið á fimmtudag og minkandi N-átt.
